qas.question: Who tried to establish a rival foothold at Bolama?
When was a rival foothold  attempted at Bolama?
Who regarded Bolama as their own in the 19th century?
What other area did the Portuguese regard as their special territory?
What rival did the Portuguese fend off in Guinea-Bissau?

context: For a brief period in <a1_0>the 1790s<a1_0/>, <a0_0><a4_0>the British<a4_0/><a0_0/> tried to establish a rival foothold on an offshore island, at Bolama. But by the 19th century <a2_0>the Portuguese<a2_0/> were sufficiently secure in Bissau to regard the neighbouring coastline as their own special territory, also up north in <a3_0>part of present South Senegal<a3_0/>.
